title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdos Problem #802:** Is it true that any K_r-free graph on n vertices with average degree t contains an independent set on (log t / t)n vertices?

**Status: SOLVED for r=3** (AKS 1980). Partial progress for general r (Shearer 1995).

title: avgDegree
content:
**Average Degree:** The average degree of a graph G is 2|E|/|V|.

This measures how dense the graph is on average.

title: IsCliqueFree
content:
**K_r-free:** A graph is K_r-free if it contains no clique of size r.

For r=3, this means triangle-free.

title: IsTriangleFree
content:
**Triangle-free:** A graph with no K_3 (triangle).

The r=3 case is special and was solved first.

title: IsIndependent
content:
**Independent Set:** A set of vertices with no edges between them.

Finding large independent sets is a central graph theory problem.

title: independenceNumber
content:
**Independence Number alpha(G):** The size of the largest independent set in G.

The AEKS conjecture gives a lower bound on alpha(G).

title: AEKSConjecture
content:
**AEKS Conjecture:** K_r-free graphs with average degree t have alpha(G) >= c_r * (log t / t) * n.

This is the main question: does forbidding K_r force large independent sets?

title: AEKS (1981)
content:
**First Bound:** alpha(G) >= c * (log log(t+1) / t) * n.

The original paper proved a weaker bound with double logarithm.

title: Shearer (1995)
content:
**Improved Bound:** alpha(G) >= c * (log t / (log log(t+1) * t)) * n.

Shearer improved the bound, but still with an extra log log factor.

title: AKS (1980)
content:
**Triangle-Free Case:** For r=3, alpha(G) >= c * (log t / t) * n.

AKS proved the full conjecture for triangle-free graphs.

title: conjecture_true_for_r3
content:
**Theorem:** The AEKS conjecture is true for r=3.

Derived from the AKS 1980 result.

title: Alon (1996)
content:
**Local Chromatic Version:** Under the stronger assumption that every neighborhood has chromatic number at most r-2, the full (log t / t) bound holds.

This is stronger than just K_r-free.

title: Ramsey Connection
content:
**Ramsey Bound:** AKS's proof gives R(3,k) >= c * k^2 / log k.

The independence bound implies Ramsey number lower bounds.

title: erdos_802
content:
**Main Result:**
1. AEKS conjecture true for r=3
2. Shearer's partial bound for general r

**Status: SOLVED for r=3, PARTIAL for general r**
